title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
While the pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook the pancetta until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and Parmesan. Season with plenty of black pepper.
Once the pasta is done, reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water, then drain the pasta.
Working quickly, add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta, away from the heat. Toss to coat in the rendered fat.
Add the egg and cheese mixture, stirring constantly. The residual heat will cook the eggs into a creamy sauce.
Add a splash of reserved pasta water if needed to thin the sauce.
Serve immediately with additional grated cheese and black pepper on top.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 800g boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, garam masala, ginger, and garlic to create a marinade.
Add chicken pieces to the marinade, coating well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place marinated chicken pieces on it.
Bake for 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through with slightly charred edges.
While chicken is baking, heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add diced onion and sauté until soft and translucent.
Add tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Stir in the cream and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Add the baked chicken pieces to the sauce and simmer for 5 more minutes to let the flavors meld.
Serve hot with rice or naan, garnished with fresh cilantro.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy mix of fresh vegetables cooked in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
instructions: Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add carrots and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add bell pepper, broccoli, and snap peas. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Add mushrooms and water chestnuts, continue stir-frying for 2 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
Pour sauce mixture over vegetables and toss to coat.
Add cornstarch slurry and stir until sauce thickens, about 1 minute.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve hot over rice or noodles.

title: Chocolate Brownie
summary: Rich, fudgy chocolate brownies with a crackly top and gooey center.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8-inch square baking pan with parchment paper.
In a heatproof bowl over simmering water (or in microwave), melt butter and dark chocolate together. Stir until smooth, then set aside to cool slightly.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs and sugar until pale and doubled in volume, about 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the vanilla extract and the melted chocolate mixture.
Sift in the flour, cocoa powder, and salt. Fold gently until just combined.
If using, fold in the chocolate chips.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs.
Allow to cool completely in the pan before cutting into squares.
